Package org.cesecore.util

Class CertTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.util.CertTools
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    QCStatementExtension, SubjectDirAttrExtension
    public abstract class CertTools
extends Object
    Tools to handle common certificate operations.
    Version:
    $Id: CertTools.java 30344 2018-11-01 13:10:21Z samuellb $

      static org.bouncycastle.pkcs.PKCS10CertificationRequest genPKCS10CertificationRequest​(String signatureAlgorithm, org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500Name subject, PublicKey publickey, org.bouncycastle.asn1.ASN1Set attributes, PrivateKey privateKey, String provider)
      Generates a PKCS10CertificationRequest Code Example: ------------- An example of putting AltName and a password challenge in an 'attributes' set (taken from RequestMessageTest.test01Pkcs10RequestMessage() ): // Create a P10 with extensions, in this case altNames with a DNS name ASN1EncodableVector altnameattr = new ASN1EncodableVector(); altnameattr.add(PKCSObjectIdentifiers.pkcs_9_at_extensionRequest); // AltNames GeneralNames san = CertTools.getGeneralNamesFromAltName("dNSName=foo1.bar.com"); ExtensionsGenerator extgen = new ExtensionsGenerator(); extgen.addExtension(Extension.subjectAlternativeName, false, san ); Extensions exts = extgen.generate(); altnameattr.add(new DERSet(exts)); // Add a challenge password as well ASN1EncodableVector pwdattr = new ASN1EncodableVector(); pwdattr.add(PKCSObjectIdentifiers.pkcs_9_at_challengePassword); ASN1EncodableVector pwdvalues = new ASN1EncodableVector(); pwdvalues.add(new DERUTF8String("foo123")); pwdattr.add(new DERSet(pwdvalues)); // Complete the Attribute section of the request, the set (Attributes) // contains one sequence (Attribute) ASN1EncodableVector v = new ASN1EncodableVector(); v.add(new DERSequence(altnameattr)); v.add(new DERSequence(pwdattr)); DERSet attributes = new DERSet(v);

      static String getGeneralNameString​(int tag, org.bouncycastle.asn1.ASN1Encodable value)
      GeneralName ::= CHOICE { otherName [0] OtherName, rfc822Name [1] IA5String, dNSName [2] IA5String, x400Address [3] ORAddress, directoryName [4] Name, ediPartyName [5] EDIPartyName, uniformResourceIdentifier [6] IA5String, iPAddress [7] OCTET STRING, registeredID [8] OBJECT IDENTIFIER}

      protected static String getKrb5PrincipalNameFromSequence​(org.bouncycastle.asn1.ASN1Sequence seq)
      Helper method for getting kerberos 5 principal name (altName, OtherName) Krb5PrincipalName is an OtherName Subject Alternative Name String representation is in form "principalname1/principalname2@realm" KRB5PrincipalName ::= SEQUENCE { realm [0] Realm, principalName [1] PrincipalName } Realm ::= KerberosString PrincipalName ::= SEQUENCE { name-type [0] Int32, name-string [1] SEQUENCE OF KerberosString } The new (post-RFC 1510) type KerberosString, defined below, is a GeneralString that is constrained to contain only characters in IA5String.

      static BigInteger getSerialNumberFromString​(String sernoString)
      Gets a serial number in numeric form, it takes - either a hex encoded integer with length != 5 (x.509 certificate) - 5 letter numeric string (cvc), will convert the number to an int - 5 letter alfanumeric string vi some numbers in it (cvc), will convert the numbers in it to a numeric string (remove the letters) and convert to int - 5 letter alfanumeric string with only letters (cvc), will convert to integer from string with radix 36

      static String getSubjectAlternativeName​(Certificate certificate)
      SubjectAltName ::= GeneralNames GeneralNames :: = SEQUENCE SIZE (1..MAX) OF GeneralName GeneralName ::= CHOICE { otherName [0] OtherName, rfc822Name [1] IA5String, dNSName [2] IA5String, x400Address [3] ORAddress, directoryName [4] Name, ediPartyName [5] EDIPartyName, uniformResourceIdentifier [6] IA5String, iPAddress [7] OCTET STRING, registeredID [8] OBJECT IDENTIFIER} SubjectAltName is of form \"rfc822Name=<email>, dNSName=<host name>, uniformResourceIdentifier=<http://host.com/>, iPAddress=<address>, guid=<globally unique id>, directoryName=<CN=testDirName|dir|name>, permanentIdentifier=<identifierValue/assigner|identifierValue|/assigner|/> Supported altNames are upn, krb5principal, rfc822Name, uniformResourceIdentifier, dNSName, iPAddress, directoryName, permanentIdentifier

      • stringToBcX500Name

        public static org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500Name stringToBcX500Name​(String dn)
        See stringToBcX500Name(String, X500NameStyle, boolean), this method uses the default name style (CeSecoreNameStyle) and ldap order
        Parameters:
        dn - String containing DN that will be transformed into X500Name, The DN string has the format "CN=zz,OU=yy,O=foo,C=SE". Unknown OIDs in the string will be added to the end positions of OID array.
        Returns:
        X500Name, which can be empty if dn does not contain any real DN components, or null if input is null
        See Also:
        stringToBcX500Name(String, X500NameStyle, boolean)

      • stringToBcX500Name

        public static org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500Name stringToBcX500Name​(String dn,
                                                                     boolean ldapOrder)
        See stringToBcX500Name(String, X500NameStyle, boolean), this method uses the default name style (CeSecoreNameStyle) and ldap order
        Parameters:
        dn - String containing DN that will be transformed into X500Name, The DN string has the format "CN=zz,OU=yy,O=foo,C=SE". Unknown OIDs in the string will be added to the end positions of OID array.
        ldapOrder - true if X500Name should be in Ldap Order
        Returns:
        X500Name, which can be empty if dn does not contain any real DN components, or null if input is null
        See Also:
        stringToBcX500Name(String, X500NameStyle, boolean)

      • stringToBcX500Name

        public static org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500Name stringToBcX500Name​(String dn,
                                                                     org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500NameStyle nameStyle,
                                                                     boolean ldaporder)
        Creates a (Bouncycastle) X500Name object from a string with a DN. Known OID (with order) are: EmailAddress, UID, CN, SN (SerialNumber), GivenName, Initials, SurName, T, OU, O, L, ST, DC, C To change order edit 'dnObjects' in this source file. Important NOT to mess with the ordering within this class, since cert vierification on some clients (IE :-() might depend on order.
        Parameters:
        dn - String containing DN that will be transformed into X500Name, The DN string has the format "CN=zz,OU=yy,O=foo,C=SE". Unknown OIDs in the string will be added to the end positions of OID array.
        nameStyle - Controls how the name is encoded. Usually it should be a CeSecoreNameStyle.
        ldaporder - true if LDAP ordering of DN should be used (default in EJBCA), false for X.500 order, ldap order is CN=A,OU=B,O=C,C=SE, x.500 order is the reverse
        Returns:
        X500Name, which can be empty if dn does not contain any real DN components, or null if input is null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if DN is not valid

      • stringToBcX500Name

        public static org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500Name stringToBcX500Name​(String dn,
                                                                     org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500NameStyle nameStyle,
                                                                     boolean ldaporder,
                                                                     String[] order)
        Same as @see stringToBcX500Name(String, X500NameStyle, boolean) but with the possibility of specifying a custom order. ONLY to be used when creating names that are transient, never for storing in the database.
        Parameters:
        dn - String containing DN that will be transformed into X500Name, The DN string has the format "CN=zz,OU=yy,O=foo,C=SE". Unknown OIDs in the string will be added to the end positions of OID array.
        nameStyle - Controls how the name is encoded. Usually it should be a CeSecoreNameStyle.
        ldaporder - true if LDAP ordering of DN should be used (default in EJBCA), false for X.500 order, ldap order is CN=A,OU=B,O=C,C=SE, x.500 order is the reverse
        order - specified order, which overrides 'ldaporder', care must be taken constructing this String array, ignored if null or empty
        Returns:
        X500Name, which can be empty if dn does not contain any real DN components, or null if input is null

                                                                     String[] order,

      • getUnescapedPlus

        public static String getUnescapedPlus​(String value)

      • handleUnescapedPlus

        public static String handleUnescapedPlus​(String dn)
        Check if the String contains any unescaped '+'. RFC 2253, section 2.2 states that '+' is used for multi-valued RelativeDistinguishedName. BC (version 1.45) did not support multi-valued RelativeDistinguishedName, and automatically escaped them instead. Even though it is now (BC 1.49b15) supported, we want to keep ecaping '+' chars and warn that this might not be supported in the future.
        Parameters:
        dn - DN
        Returns:
        escaped DN

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        String containing DN, or empty string if dn does not contain any real DN components, or null if input is null

      • getEmailFromDN

        public static ArrayList<String> getEmailFromDN​(String dn)
        Convenience method for getting an email addresses from a DN. Uses getPartsFromDN(String,String) internally, and searches for EMAIL, EMAIL1, EMAIL2, EMAIL3 and returns the first one found.
        Parameters:
        dn - the DN
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing email or empty list if email is not present

      • getEMailAddress

        public static String getEMailAddress​(Certificate certificate)
        Search for e-mail address, first in SubjectAltName (as in PKIX recommendation) then in subject DN. Original author: Marco Ferrante, (c) 2005 CSITA - University of Genoa (Italy)
        Parameters:
        certificate - certificate
        Returns:
        subject email or null if not present in certificate

      • reverseDN

        public static String reverseDN​(String dn)
        Takes a DN and reverses it completely so the first attribute ends up last. C=SE,O=Foo,CN=Bar becomes CN=Bar,O=Foo,C=SE.
        Parameters:
        dn - String containing DN to be reversed, The DN string has the format "C=SE, O=xx, OU=yy, CN=zz".
        Returns:
        String containing reversed DN

      • isDNReversed

        public static boolean isDNReversed​(String dn)
        Tries to determine if a DN is in reversed form. It does this by taking the last attribute and the first attribute. If the last attribute comes before the first in the dNObjects array the DN is assumed to be in reversed order. The default ordering is: "CN=Tomas, O=PrimeKey, C=SE" (dNObjectsForward ordering in EJBCA) a dn or form "C=SE, O=PrimeKey, CN=Tomas" is reversed. If the string has only one component (e.g. "CN=example.com") then this method returns false. If the string does not contain any real DN components, it returns false.
        Parameters:
        dn - String containing DN to be checked, The DN string has the format "C=SE, O=xx, OU=yy, CN=zz".
        Returns:
        true if the DN is believed to be in reversed order, false otherwise

      • dnHasMultipleComponents

        public static boolean dnHasMultipleComponents​(String dn)
        Checks if a DN has at least two components. Then the DN can be in either LDAP or X500 order. Otherwise it's not possible to determine the order.
        Parameters:
        dn - DN
        Returns:
        boolean

      • getPartFromDN

        public static String getPartFromDN​(String dn,
                                   String dnpart)
        Gets a specified part of a DN. Specifically the first occurrence it the DN contains several instances of a part (i.e. cn=x, cn=y returns x).
        Parameters:
        dn - String containing DN, The DN string has the format "C=SE, O=xx, OU=yy, CN=zz".
        dnpart - String specifying which part of the DN to get, should be "CN" or "OU" etc.
        Returns:
        String containing dnpart or null if dnpart is not present

      • getPartsFromDN

        public static List<String> getPartsFromDN​(String dn,
                                          String dnpart)
        Gets a specified parts of a DN. Returns all occurrences as an ArrayList, also works if DN contains several instances of a part (i.e. cn=x, cn=y returns {x, y, null}).
        Parameters:
        dn - String containing DN, The DN string has the format "C=SE, O=xx, OU=yy, CN=zz".
        dnpart - String specifying which part of the DN to get, should be "CN" or "OU" etc.
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing dnparts or empty list if dnpart is not present

                                                  boolean onlyReturnFirstMatch)

      • getCustomOids

        public static ArrayList<String> getCustomOids​(String dn)
        Gets a list of all custom OIDs defined in the string. A custom OID is defined as an OID, simply as that. Otherwise, if it is not a custom oid, the DNpart is defined by a name such as CN och rfc822Name. This method only returns a oid once, so if the input string has multiple of the same oid, only one value is returned.
        Parameters:
        dn - String containing DN, The DN string has the format "C=SE, O=xx, OU=yy, CN=zz", or "rfc822Name=foo@bar.com", etc.
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing unique oids or empty list if no custom OIDs are present

      • getSerialNumber

        public static BigInteger getSerialNumber​(Certificate cert)
        Gets Serial number of the certificate.
        Parameters:
        cert - Certificate
        Returns:
        BigInteger containing the certificate serial number. Can be 0 for CVC certificates with alphanumeric serial numbers if the sequence does not contain any number characters at all.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if null input of certificate type is not handled

      • getSerialNumberFromString

        public static BigInteger getSerialNumberFromString​(String sernoString)
        Gets a serial number in numeric form, it takes - either a hex encoded integer with length != 5 (x.509 certificate) - 5 letter numeric string (cvc), will convert the number to an int - 5 letter alfanumeric string vi some numbers in it (cvc), will convert the numbers in it to a numeric string (remove the letters) and convert to int - 5 letter alfanumeric string with only letters (cvc), will convert to integer from string with radix 36
        Parameters:
        sernoString - serial
        Returns:
        BigInteger

      • getSerialNumberAsString

        public static String getSerialNumberAsString​(Certificate cert)
        Gets Serial number of the certificate as a string. For X509 Certificate this means a HEX encoded BigInteger, and for CVC certificate is means the sequence field of the holder reference.

        For X509 certificates, the value is normalized (uppercase without leading zeros), so there's no need to normalize the returned value.

        Parameters:
        cert - Certificate
        Returns:
        String to be displayed, or used in RoleMember objects

      • getSignature

        public static byte[] getSignature​(Certificate cert)
        Gets the signature value (the raw signature bits) from the certificate. For an X509 certificate this is the ASN.1 definition which is: signature BIT STRING
        Parameters:
        cert - Certificate
        Returns:
        byte[] containing the certificate signature bits, if cert is null a byte[] of size 0 is returned.

        @Deprecated
public static List<Certificate> getCertsFromPEM​(String certFilename)
                                         throws FileNotFoundException,
                                                CertificateParsingException
        Deprecated.
        Use org.cesecore.util.CertTools.getCertsFromPEM(String, Class<T>) instead
        Reads certificates in PEM-format from a filename. The stream may contain other things between the different certificates.
        Parameters:
        certFilename - filename of the file containing the certificates in PEM-format
        Returns:
        Ordered List of Certificates, first certificate first, or empty List
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if certFile was not found
        CertificateParsingException - if the file contains an incorrect certificate.

      • getCertsFromPEM

        public static <T extends Certificate> List<T> getCertsFromPEM​(String certFilename,
                                                              Class<T> returnType)
                                                       throws FileNotFoundException,
                                                              CertificateParsingException
        Reads certificates in PEM-format from a filename. The stream may contain other things between the different certificates.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type
        Parameters:
        certFilename - filename of the file containing the certificates in PEM-format
        returnType - a Class specifying the desired return type. Certificate can be used if return type is unknown.
        Returns:
        Ordered List of Certificates, first certificate first, or empty List
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if certFile was not found
        CertificateParsingException - if the file contains an incorrect certificate.

      • readCertificateChainAsArrayOrThrow

        public static final byte[] readCertificateChainAsArrayOrThrow​(String file)
                                                       throws FileNotFoundException,
                                                              IOException,
                                                              CertificateParsingException,
                                                              CertificateEncodingException
        Reads a CA certificate and its certificate chain by a file. If it is a chain it is a file with multiple PEM encoded certificates. A single certificate is either in PEM or binary format.
        Parameters:
        file - the full path of the file.
        Returns:
        a byte array containing one PEM or binary certificate, or all certificates in the chain in PEM format. First is the CA certificate, followed by its certificate chain.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found.
        IOException - on IO error
        CertificateParsingException - if a certificate could not be parsed.
        CertificateEncodingException - if a certificate cannot be encoded.

        CertificateParsingException - if certificate couldn't be parsed from cert

      • getCertfromByteArray

        public static <T extends Certificate> T getCertfromByteArray​(byte[] cert,
                                                             String provider,
                                                             Class<T> returnType)
                                                      throws CertificateParsingException
        Creates Certificate from byte[], can be either an X509 certificate or a CVCCertificate
        Type Parameters:
        T - type
        Parameters:
        cert - byte array containing certificate in binary (DER) format, or PEM encoded X.509 certificate
        provider - provider for example "SUN" or "BC", use null for the default provider (BC)
        returnType - the type of Certificate to be returned. Certificate can be used if certificate type is unknown.
        Returns:
        a Certificate
        Throws:
        CertificateParsingException - if certificate couldn't be parsed from cert, or if the incorrect return type was specified.

                                        throws CertificateParsingException
        Deprecated.
        Use org.cesecore.util.CertTools.getCertfromByteArray(byte[], Class<T>) to specify return type instead.
        Parameters:
        cert - vertificate
        Returns:
        certificate
        Throws:
        CertificateParsingException - if the byte array does not contain a proper certificate.

      • genSelfCert

        public static X509Certificate genSelfCert​(String dn,
                                          long validity,
                                          String policyId,
                                          PrivateKey privKey,
                                          PublicKey pubKey,
                                          String sigAlg,
                                          boolean isCA)
                                   throws org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException,
                                          CertificateException
        Generate a selfsigned certificate.
        Parameters:
        dn - subject and issuer DN
        validity - in days
        policyId - policy string ('2.5.29.32.0') or null
        privKey - private key
        pubKey - public key
        sigAlg - signature algorithm, you can use one of the contants AlgorithmConstants.SIGALG_XXX
        isCA - boolean true or false
        Returns:
        X509Certificate, self signed
        Throws:
        CertificateException - If cert cannot be parsed
        org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException - if creation fails

      • genSelfCert

        public static X509Certificate genSelfCert​(String dn,
                                          long validity,
                                          String policyId,
                                          PrivateKey privKey,
                                          PublicKey pubKey,
                                          String sigAlg,
                                          boolean isCA,
                                          String provider,
                                          boolean ldapOrder)
                                   throws CertificateParsingException,
                                          org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException
        Generates a self signed certificate with keyUsage X509KeyUsage.keyCertSign + X509KeyUsage.cRLSign, i.e. a CA certificate

        privKey - private key
        pubKey - public key
        sigAlg - signature algorithm, you can use one of the contants AlgorithmConstants.SIGALG_XXX
        isCA - boolean true or false
        provider - jce provider
        ldapOrder - true to sort
        Returns:
        X509Certificate, self signed
        Throws:
        CertificateParsingException - If cert cannot be parsed
        org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException - if creation fails

      • getUPNAltName

        public static String getUPNAltName​(Certificate cert)
                            throws IOException,
                                   CertificateParsingException
        Gets the Microsoft specific UPN altName (altName, OtherName). UPN is an OtherName Subject Alternative Name: OtherName ::= SEQUENCE { type-id OBJECT IDENTIFIER, value [0] EXPLICIT ANY DEFINED BY type-id } UPN ::= UTF8String
        Parameters:
        cert - certificate containing the extension
        Returns:
        String with the UPN name or null if the altName does not exist
        Throws:
        IOException - On disk error
        CertificateParsingException - if cert parse fails

      • getUTF8AltNameOtherName

        public static String getUTF8AltNameOtherName​(Certificate cert,
                                             String oid)
                                      throws IOException,
                                             CertificateParsingException
        Gets a UTF8 OtherName altName (altName, OtherName). Like UPN and XmpAddr An OtherName Subject Alternative Name: OtherName ::= SEQUENCE { type-id OBJECT IDENTIFIER, value [0] EXPLICIT ANY DEFINED BY type-id } UPN ::= UTF8String (subjectAltName=otherName:1.3.6.1.4.1.311.20.2.3;UTF8:username@some.domain) XmppAddr ::= UTF8String (subjectAltName=otherName:1.3.6.1.5.5.7.8.5;UTF8:username@some.domain) CertTools.UPN_OBJECTID = "1.3.6.1.4.1.311.20.2.3"; CertTools.XMPPADDR_OBJECTID = "1.3.6.1.5.5.7.8.5"; CertTools.SRVNAME_OBJECTID = "1.3.6.1.5.5.7.8.7";
        Parameters:
        cert - certificate containing the extension
        oid - the OID of the OtherName
        Returns:
        String with the UTF8 name or null if the altName does not exist
        Throws:
        IOException - On disk error
        CertificateParsingException - if cert parse fails

      • getPermanentIdentifierAltName

        public static String getPermanentIdentifierAltName​(Certificate cert)
                                            throws IOException,
                                                   CertificateParsingException
        Gets the Permanent Identifier (altName, OtherName). permanentIdentifier is an OtherName Subject Alternative Name: OtherName ::= SEQUENCE { type-id OBJECT IDENTIFIER, value [0] EXPLICIT ANY DEFINED BY type-id } -- Permanent Identifier permanentIdentifier OTHER-NAME ::= { PermanentIdentifier IDENTIFIED BY id-on-permanentIdentifier } PermanentIdentifier ::= SEQUENCE { identifierValue UTF8String OPTIONAL, -- if absent, use the serialNumber attribute -- if there is a single such attribute present -- in the subject DN assigner OBJECT IDENTIFIER OPTIONAL -- if absent, the assigner is -- the certificate issuer }
        Parameters:
        cert - certificate containing the extension
        Returns:
        String with the permanentIdentifier name or null if the altName does not exist
        Throws:
        IOException - On disk error
        CertificateParsingException - if cert parse fails

      • getKrb5PrincipalNameFromSequence

        protected static String getKrb5PrincipalNameFromSequence​(org.bouncycastle.asn1.ASN1Sequence seq)
        Helper method for getting kerberos 5 principal name (altName, OtherName) Krb5PrincipalName is an OtherName Subject Alternative Name String representation is in form "principalname1/principalname2@realm" KRB5PrincipalName ::= SEQUENCE { realm [0] Realm, principalName [1] PrincipalName } Realm ::= KerberosString PrincipalName ::= SEQUENCE { name-type [0] Int32, name-string [1] SEQUENCE OF KerberosString } The new (post-RFC 1510) type KerberosString, defined below, is a GeneralString that is constrained to contain only characters in IA5String. KerberosString ::= GeneralString (IA5String) Int32 ::= INTEGER (-2147483648..2147483647) -- signed values representable in 32 bits
        Parameters:
        seq - the OtherName sequence
        Returns:
        String with the krb5 name in the form of "principal1/principal2@realm" or null if the altName does not exist

      • getSubjectAlternativeName

        public static String getSubjectAlternativeName​(Certificate certificate)
        SubjectAltName ::= GeneralNames GeneralNames :: = SEQUENCE SIZE (1..MAX) OF GeneralName GeneralName ::= CHOICE { otherName [0] OtherName, rfc822Name [1] IA5String, dNSName [2] IA5String, x400Address [3] ORAddress, directoryName [4] Name, ediPartyName [5] EDIPartyName, uniformResourceIdentifier [6] IA5String, iPAddress [7] OCTET STRING, registeredID [8] OBJECT IDENTIFIER} SubjectAltName is of form \"rfc822Name=<email>, dNSName=<host name>, uniformResourceIdentifier=<http://host.com/>, iPAddress=<address>, guid=<globally unique id>, directoryName=<CN=testDirName|dir|name>, permanentIdentifier=<identifierValue/assigner|identifierValue|/assigner|/> Supported altNames are upn, krb5principal, rfc822Name, uniformResourceIdentifier, dNSName, iPAddress, directoryName, permanentIdentifier
        Parameters:
        certificate - containing alt names
        Returns:
        String containing altNames of form "rfc822Name=email, dNSName=hostname, uniformResourceIdentifier=uri, iPAddress=ip, upn=upn, directoryName=CN=testDirName|dir|name", permanentIdentifier=identifierValue/assigner or empty string if no altNames exist. Values in returned String is from CertTools constants. AltNames not supported are simply not shown in the resulting string.

        GeneralName ::= CHOICE { otherName [0] OtherName, rfc822Name [1] IA5String, dNSName [2] IA5String, x400Address [3] ORAddress, directoryName [4] Name, ediPartyName [5] EDIPartyName, uniformResourceIdentifier [6] IA5String, iPAddress [7] OCTET STRING, registeredID [8] OBJECT IDENTIFIER}

      • verifyWithTrustedCertificates

        public static boolean verifyWithTrustedCertificates​(X509Certificate certificate,
                                                    List<Collection<X509Certificate>> trustedCertificates,
                                                    PKIXCertPathChecker... pkixCertPathCheckers)
        Check the certificate with a list of trusted certificates. The trusted certificates list can either be end entity certificates, in this case, only this certificate by this issuer is trusted; or it could be CA certificates, in this case, all certificates issued by this CA are trusted.
        Parameters:
        certificate - certificate to verify
        trustedCertificates - collection of trusted X509Certificates
        pkixCertPathCheckers - optional PKIXCertPathChecker implementations to use during cert path validation
        Returns:
        true if verified OK

      • checkValidity

        public static void checkValidity​(Certificate cert,
                                 Date date)
                          throws CertificateExpiredException,
                                 CertificateNotYetValidException
        Checks that the given date is within the certificate's validity period. In other words, this determines whether the certificate would be valid at the given date/time. This utility class is only a helper to get the same behavior as the standard java.security.cert API regardless if using X.509 or CV Certificate.
        Parameters:
        cert - certificate to verify, if null the method returns immediately, null does not have a validity to check.
        date - the Date to check against to see if this certificate is valid at that date/time.
        Throws:
        CertificateExpiredException - - if the certificate has expired with respect to the date supplied.
        CertificateNotYetValidException - - if the certificate is not yet valid with respect to the date supplied.
        See Also:
        X509Certificate.checkValidity(Date)

      • getCrlDistributionPoint

        public static URL getCrlDistributionPoint​(Certificate certificate)
        Return the first CRL distribution points. The CRL distributions points are URL specified in the certificate extension CRLDistributionPoints with OID 2.5.29.31. The CRLDistributionPoints extension contains a sequece of DistributionPoint, which has the following structure: DistributionPoint ::= SEQUENCE { distributionPoint [0] DistributionPointName OPTIONAL, reasons [1] ReasonFlags OPTIONAL, cRLIssuer [2] GeneralNames OPTIONAL } This method extracts "distributionPoint" (tag 0) from the first DistributionPoint included in the extension. No other tags are read.
        Parameters:
        certificate - certificate
        Returns:
        A URL, or null if no CRL distribution points were found

      • getCrlDistributionPoints

        public static Collection<URL> getCrlDistributionPoints​(X509Certificate x509cert)
        Return a list of CRL distribution points. The CRL distributions points are URL specified in the certificate extension CRLDistributionPoints with OID 2.5.29.31. The CRLDistributionPoints extension contains a sequece of DistributionPoint, which has the following structure: DistributionPoint ::= SEQUENCE { distributionPoint [0] DistributionPointName OPTIONAL, reasons [1] ReasonFlags OPTIONAL, cRLIssuer [2] GeneralNames OPTIONAL } This method extracts "distributionPoint" (tag 0) from every DistributionPoint included in the extension. No other tags are read.
        Parameters:
        x509cert - X.509 cert
        Returns:
        A list of URLs

      • sunKeyUsageToBC

        public static int sunKeyUsageToBC​(boolean[] sku)
        Converts Sun Key usage bits to Bouncy castle key usage kits
        Parameters:
        sku - key usage bit fields according to java.security.cert.X509Certificate#getKeyUsage, must be a boolean aray of size 9.
        Returns:
        key usage int according to org.bouncycastle.jce.X509KeyUsage#X509KeyUsage, or -1 if input is null.
        See Also:
        X509Certificate.getKeyUsage(), X509KeyUsage(int)

      • insertCNPostfix

        public static String insertCNPostfix​(String dn,
                                     String cnpostfix,
                                     org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500NameStyle nameStyle)
        Method used to insert a CN postfix into DN by extracting the first found CN appending cnpostfix and then replacing the original CN with the new one in DN. If no CN could be found in DN then should the given DN be returned untouched
        Parameters:
        dn - the DN to manipulate, cannot be null
        cnpostfix - the postfix to insert, cannot be null
        nameStyle - Controls how the name is encoded. Usually it should be a CeSecoreNameStyle.
        Returns:
        the new DN

      • getParentDN

        public static String getParentDN​(String dn)
        Returns the parent DN of a DN string, e.g. if the input is "cn=User,dc=example,dc=com" then it would return "dc=example,dc=com". Returns an empty string if there is no parent DN.
        Parameters:
        dn - DN
        Returns:
        Parent DN

      • getX509FieldOrder

        public static List<org.bouncycastle.asn1.ASN1ObjectIdentifier> getX509FieldOrder​(boolean ldaporder)
        Obtains a List with the ASN1ObjectIdentifiers for dNObjects names, in the specified pre-defined order
        Parameters:
        ldaporder - if true the returned order are as defined in LDAP RFC (CN=foo,O=bar,C=SE), otherwise the order is a defined in X.500 (C=SE,O=bar,CN=foo).
        Returns:
        a List with ASN1ObjectIdentifiers defining the known order we require
        See Also:
        DnComponents.getDnObjects(boolean)

      • createCertChain

        public static List<Certificate> createCertChain​(Collection<?> certlistin)
                                         throws CertPathValidatorException,
                                                InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                NoSuchProviderException,
                                                CertificateException
        Method to create certificate path and to check it's validity from a list of certificates. The list of certificates should only contain one root certificate. The created certificate chain is checked to be valid at the current date and time.
        Parameters:
        certlistin - List of certificates to create certificate chain from.
        Returns:
        the certificatepath with the root CA at the end
        Throws:
        CertPathValidatorException - if the certificate chain can not be constructed or validated
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - If params are invalid
        NoSuchProviderException - If provider not found
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If algorithm not found
        CertificateException - If certificate cannot be parsed

      • createCertChain

        public static List<Certificate> createCertChain​(Collection<?> certlistin,
                                                Date now)
                                         throws CertPathValidatorException,
                                                InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                NoSuchProviderException,
                                                CertificateException
        Method to create certificate path and to check it's validity from a list of certificates. The list of certificates should only contain one root certificate.
        Parameters:
        certlistin - List of certificates (X.509, CVC, or other supported) to create certificate chain from.
        now - Date to use when checking if the CAs chain is valid.
        Returns:
        the certificate path with the root CA at the end
        Throws:
        CertPathValidatorException - if the certificate chain can not be constructed
        InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - If params are invalid
        NoSuchProviderException - If provider not found
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - If algorithm not found
        CertificateException - If certificate cannot be parsed

      • orderX509CertificateChain

        public static List<X509Certificate> orderX509CertificateChain​(List<X509Certificate> certlist)
                                                       throws CertPathValidatorException
        Method ordering a list of X509 certificate into a certificate path with the root CA, or topmost Sub CA at the end. Does not check validity or verification of any kind, just ordering by issuerdn/keyId. This is mostly a wrapper around CertPath.generateCertPath, but we do regression test this ordering.
        Parameters:
        certlist - list of certificates to order can be collection of Certificate or byte[] (der encoded certs).
        Returns:
        List with certificate chain with leaf certificate first, and root CA, or last sub CA, in the end, does not have to contain a Root CA is input does not.
        Throws:
        CertPathValidatorException - if validation fails

      • genPKCS10CertificationRequest

        public static org.bouncycastle.pkcs.PKCS10CertificationRequest genPKCS10CertificationRequest​(String signatureAlgorithm,
                                                                                             org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500Name subject,
                                                                                             PublicKey publickey,
                                                                                             org.bouncycastle.asn1.ASN1Set attributes,
                                                                                             PrivateKey privateKey,
                                                                                             String provider)
                                                                                      throws org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException
        Generates a PKCS10CertificationRequest Code Example: ------------- An example of putting AltName and a password challenge in an 'attributes' set (taken from RequestMessageTest.test01Pkcs10RequestMessage() ): // Create a P10 with extensions, in this case altNames with a DNS name ASN1EncodableVector altnameattr = new ASN1EncodableVector(); altnameattr.add(PKCSObjectIdentifiers.pkcs_9_at_extensionRequest); // AltNames GeneralNames san = CertTools.getGeneralNamesFromAltName("dNSName=foo1.bar.com"); ExtensionsGenerator extgen = new ExtensionsGenerator(); extgen.addExtension(Extension.subjectAlternativeName, false, san ); Extensions exts = extgen.generate(); altnameattr.add(new DERSet(exts)); // Add a challenge password as well ASN1EncodableVector pwdattr = new ASN1EncodableVector(); pwdattr.add(PKCSObjectIdentifiers.pkcs_9_at_challengePassword); ASN1EncodableVector pwdvalues = new ASN1EncodableVector(); pwdvalues.add(new DERUTF8String("foo123")); pwdattr.add(new DERSet(pwdvalues)); // Complete the Attribute section of the request, the set (Attributes) // contains one sequence (Attribute) ASN1EncodableVector v = new ASN1EncodableVector(); v.add(new DERSequence(altnameattr)); v.add(new DERSequence(pwdattr)); DERSet attributes = new DERSet(v);
        Parameters:
        signatureAlgorithm - the signature algorithm to sign the CSR.
        subject - the request's subject DN.
        publickey - the public key of the CSR.
        attributes - a set of attributes, for example, extensions, challenge password, etc.
        privateKey - the private key used to sign the CSR.
        provider - the JCA/JCE provider to use.
        Returns:
        a PKCS10CertificateRequest based on the input parameters.
        Throws:
        org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException - if an error occurred while creating the signing key

      • createCertsOnlyCMS

        public static byte[] createCertsOnlyCMS​(List<X509Certificate> x509CertificateChain)
                                 throws CertificateEncodingException,
                                        org.bouncycastle.cms.CMSException
        Create a "certs-only" PKCS#7 / CMS from the provided chain.
        Parameters:
        x509CertificateChain - chain of certificates with the leaf in the first position and root in the last or just a leaf certificate.
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the CMS
        Throws:
        CertificateEncodingException - if the provided list of certificates could not be parsed correctly
        org.bouncycastle.cms.CMSException - if there was a problem creating the certs-only CMS message

      • checkNameConstraints

        public static void checkNameConstraints​(X509Certificate issuer,
                                        org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500Name subjectDNName,
                                        org.bouncycastle.asn1.x509.GeneralNames subjectAltName)
                                 throws IllegalNameException
        Checks that the given SubjectDN / SAN satisfies the Name Constraints of the given issuer (if there are any). This method checks the Name Constraints in the given issuer only. A complete implementation of name constraints should check the whole certificate chain.
        Parameters:
        issuer - Issuing CA.
        subjectDNName - Subject DN to check. Optional.
        subjectAltName - Subject Alternative Name to check. Optional.
        Throws:
        IllegalNameException - if the name(s) didn't pass naming constraints

                                                      String algorithm)
        Creates a public key fingerprint with the given digest algorithm.
        Parameters:
        publicKey - the public key.
        algorithm - the digest algorithm (i.e. MD-5, SHA-1, SHA-256, etc.)
        Returns:
        the public key fingerprint or null.
